: ... hi, Aki-chan! Do you know how landing works? W-without falling?
: Hmm... maybe try to slow down as you're reaching the ground.
: Uuu... it's more that when I try to start going down at all, it just turns into falling.
: Ah... yeah, that is a problem.
: Dunno if I can help you much, I'm afraid. I'm not really into flying, myself.
: Oh, well. What's your favourite power?
: Eh... I didn't really become a Reaper for the powers.
flutters her wings behind her, slightly confused. "So you don't like having powers?"
: I dunno if I'd say that.
: Haha, sorry. It's a little complicated.
: Okay! Did you choose to be a reaper 'cause you won, or?
: Huh. What's the Game like in Kyoto?
: It's, uh... it's a little hectic. For the Players.
: You gotta keep on your toes.
: ...You don't wanna get caught by a Reaper in Kyoto.
: ... but then how do the Players get stronger?
: Well... we still can't attack Players directly, until late in the Game.
: ...Well, you gotta keep your wits about you.
: What do reapers do early on?
: ...It sounds like the Game's a little more relaxed here.
wide eyes. "What kind of traps? An' yeah, players an' reapers tend to make friends..."
: ...You sure ask a lot of questions, pal.
: Nah, it's okay. I get it.
: You're just a kid, right? You wanna learn.
nod, nod. "I wasn't 'lowed to learn before I died, so being able to ask questions is new. I don't mean to bother you."
: If you don't mind me asking.
: 'Cause it wasn't about demons so it wouldn't help me work better an' as such I didn't need to know it.
shrugs, wings fluttering. "I don't hafta go back there, so I'm happy."
: So when'd you become a Reaper? Sounds like you haven't been one for too long.
is rocking back and forth on her heels until she jumps up high enough to be fluttering in the air. "... I dunno what to talk about if it's not asking questions. Sorry."
: I heard there was a pretty, uh... messy Game recently.
: Did you want to know anything about it?
: I'm a little curious, I admit.
: Okay! ... Uhhh. What did you want to know?
: All I know is there's something about static and monsters and you guys lost a few Reapers.
: Our Game Master was Grizz. His story came out over the course of the Week.
: He was initially a man called Seki, who got infected by static because of his first Composer or something, and the static possessed him and erased his memory.
: The static was a hivemind demon. Part of it fragmented off to become Grizz.
: Grizz didn't remember anything before he woke up as mostly static one day-- his body was all made of static 'cept his lower face.
: So he was in Shibuya an' established himself enough to become Game Master.

: But then some guy, Gen I think, came looking for Seki, and managed to connect Seki to Grizz. He tried to call out Seki by talking through Grizz, but only managed to weaken Grizz's ability to maintain control over the body.
: Static took over at that point, changing his form to that of the demon.
: Another reaper, Kyoka, was in love with Seki, an' had been chasing him since they died.
: She's the one who gave all this exposition.
: So anyway, Seki took control over the body, but didn't know where he was or what was going on. He recognised Kyoka only.
: Me and April were pretty much Grizz's adopted daughters. So April ran up to Seki while he was talking to Kyoka, an' tried to talk through Seki to bring Grizz back out.
: Kyoka was talking to Seki and acting as a focus for that personality. April was doing the same for Grizz.
: It made the two personalities unstable enough that they both lost control and Static took over again.

: The next time Seki appeared, he was begging Kyoka not to come near him, but she didn't listen and did it anyway. Static forcibly took control and killed Kyoka when she got too close. Kei and Jean couldn't do anything to stop it. I didn't see that part, but extrapolated from what I heard an' saw later.
: Grizz appeared next. He was looking for the bracelet April had given him, that Seki lost. April saw him and ran to him, despite him begging her to stay away.

: ... Really, I dunno why nobody just grabbed her and flew away. There was totally time. Instead, everyone was just yelling at her to get back, even though they were lots stronger than she was an' could easily have just grabbed her an' run while Grizz was still in control. I couldn't, 'cause Rei was holding me too tight, but the others were just standing there, and I still don't know why. There was a period of time where April wasn't even touching him and Grizz was still in control.

: But anyway, nobody did, and she didn't understand not to approach the demon-possessed guy, so Static took control and murdered her. Her soul was locked in a pin. Now she's a kitten. Her partner died without ever knowing what hit him.

: This was later revealed to be all part of Static's plan. They let Seki and Grizz have control, knowing they were stronger than either host, and waited until the people they loved most approached them. The people who were capable of calling either of them out.
: Then they forced their way into control and brutally murdered those loved ones, crushing Seki and Grizz's wills and allowing Static to have complete control.
: Seki had no other focus but Kyoka, so he was gone completely, but Grizz was still in there somewhere.
: Static said he relinquished control completely in order to make sure they didn't hurt me. I still dunno if they were lying, but they sure couldn't hurt me too much.
: This all culminated into Static being a giant static bison on the seventh day and sweeping the six of us remaining Players into the plane to fight them.
: All of the reapers joined in to help.
: They tried psychological warfare an' it was pretty clear Grizz was in there somewhere still, but...
: Grizz was too weak and broken. Seki was dead.
: We beat down Static and it took the remnants of the host with it.
: Once we thought the victory was complete, we left to the UG, and Static... reformed.
: Kuroko tore off his mask and had feathery wings and a glowing sword and stabbed Static until they died for good.

: The other reaper we lost was Kazuya, who wanted to be erased 'cause he hated being a reaper an' erasing people so much. Kei got mad at him and said he wouldn't erase a reaper who'd done his job, so now Kazuya's gonna replay the Game, but can never be a reaper again.
: ... You're the first person who's actually listened to me explain any of this, so thanks, I guess.
: Informative, good attention to detail. I give you an A+.
smiles a bit bashfully. "Thank you."
: I think the officers an' stuff are still recovering now. There's a lot of paperwork and most of them exhausted themselves all week running after Static. So that's why they haven't been around.
: Guess I picked a real bad time to bring my brother to Shibuya.
: ... Yeah, probably. I think giant demon static bison is a bit worse than giant mind controlling manipulative spider.
: Wow, I wonder what next week will be like if they keep getting exponentially more terrifying!
: I dunno, I don't think I like the sound of a giant mind-controlling spider, either.
: But, yeah. Hopefully that was just a one-off.
: Apparently she only violated a few reapers' minds and was generally manipulative and deception-y instead of wreaking havoc, irrevocably killing reapers, and driving all the officers to exhaustion.
: It's like, the week before last involved the GM destroying other people's minds. Last week was about the GM destroying their own!
: Maybe we can get a break...
: ...Oh, that actually happened? Jeez, I thought you were joking.
: Shibuya's had a rough time lately.
: That was the week before mine. Aya-kishi an' Ama-joou told me about it. I dunno what any other weeks were like...
: Well, I hope you guys get everything sorted out soon, in any case.
nods! "How long are you an' your brother staying for? Is he a reaper too?"
